channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned bike at bus stop, 16th June
item.description:
Another abandoned anywhere bike abandoned in front of a bus stop so Bus passengers cannot actually get to read the timetable. This is enough, get rid of this horrible dry scheme. It is blighting society. It is abundantly clear for anybody that hires these human forest lime et cetera bikes does not have the human decency to consider the rest of society therefore the service should not be offered to them because it is actually making it dangerous for the majority of people out there as pedestrians on the pavements

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32-40, Blackfriars Road, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More waste all over pavement, 16th June
item.description:
Once again there is a load of domestic waste and rubbish all over the pavement outside these flats. Please can someone explain what is being done? Why do I need to report this every single week for then Veolia to come and clean up after these people? Why canâ€™t they either 1) take their bin out in the morning 2) organise a shared domestic refuse bin 3) get a black bin like the rest of us? Itâ€™s completely unbelievable this has been going on for months and months and nobody at the council seems to be batting an eyelid yet our council tax is being used to clean up after these people on an almost daily basis!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Bridge to Windmill Bridge Junction, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weekly fly tipping, 16th June
item.description:
There are frequently large amounts of rubbish dumped here on the Victorian Grove estate. It has been a persistent issue for the last 7 months at least

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victorian Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned bike, 16th June
item.description:
Another abandoned human forest bike in the middle of the pavement which is dangerous for all pedestrians, especially those infirm and disabled. ðŸ’¼ Ben and cancel these horrible bikes. Iâ€™ve reported a huge number of them already this morning on my walk to work.

item.title: Continued blocking of pavement, 16th June
item.description:
The pavement continues to be blocked for wheelchair and single file walking. This has been an issue for at least 18 months between 62 & 82.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The grass in all of Priory Gardens, 16th June
item.description:
The grass in the whole park needs cutting including the entrances and in the area on church hill by the priory buildings. The grass should be cut and collected as it is so tall it is dirty full of dog mess leaving it on the grass will cause a health hazard the same same as true in most areas of the park. I have been working there yesterday for friends of Priory Gardens And it really is not hygienic to have the grass left this long.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Church Hill, Goddington, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive graffiti, 16th June
item.description:
Excessive graffiti all over a building at the end of Ruelle Street a street but the council and residence pride in being a local film set on a regular basis and we have this light on the area the only graffiti to be seen get rid of it. Itâ€™s shameful.
